data.text: @TaleSpun @_MoonlightP It is. My favorite DQ game. Not owning the original cartridge for Chrono Trigger, it was a no brainer for me to get DQV signed by Horii.
@_MoonlightP @TaleSpun I think that's the smart choice. Unless you were infatuated with DQ, I don't recommend prepping up for a DQ game by playing another one. It'll be easy to burn out that way.
@_MoonlightP @Rhapsody39 I actually played a bit of DQV earlier in the year. Very comfy.

@_MoonlightP @TaleSpun Yeah, treat it as an atmospheric game, and the little arcs for each town. I told myself I might pass on getting it at launch so I can go to a tournament, but September 4th is so close...
@Rhapsody39 @TaleSpun there's an instinct for me to play dqv too lol, but i already chose vc1 as my game to prep for something next month

@Rhapsody39 @TaleSpun yeah, if i start dq i'm probably just gonna try playing a bit every night or every other night. i know it's a long game so i'm already thinking about how i should pace myself through it to avoid burnout
@TaleSpun i love hearing people on their bullshit for extended lengths of time which is the entirety of that tim rogers video

@_MoonlightP @TaleSpun It's a good franchise. It's ok to go through a slow burn on DQ games. It's hard to go back to after a long hiatus, but I think managing it once a week is still a pleasurable experience.
@_MoonlightP I was gonna mention that! I have yet to watch that, but I do love Tim. And yeah, that Waypoint review… noooot the sites finest hour.

@TaleSpun i guess the general excitement from others, but namely watching tim rogers gush about how much he loves dragon quest for 40 minutes

it helps the counterpoints (namely the waypoint review) were. less than convincing
@_MoonlightP Ha, probably. What changed your mind? Reviews?
@TaleSpun *2019

@TaleSpun at the rate i consume games i will get half-way through dqxi before vc4 comes out, play that instead, and when i finish it around the beginning of 2018 i'll realize i have no idea where i am in dq anymore
@_MoonlightP The good thing is the gap between both, so there’s plenty of time to prioritize one over the other!

@_MoonlightP Yeah, it’s just so good-natured. It’s comforting.

DQXI… There’s just too many games really.

@TaleSpun vc is such a singular game in tone and scale, for as many issues i have with it i'm happy to have another. probably the game i'm most excited for next month

though still debating on dqxi

@_MoonlightP Yes, exactly. It was always the biggest sticking point for me. I don’t think the game is enough of a real sim to argue for speed.

Speaking of, I did start the VC4 demo and whew boy is it good to have the series back.

@TaleSpun vc4 already seems to fix at least a few issues with a new exhaustion mechanic meant to discourage repeat uses of units and the god-send that is reducing tank AP usage from 2 to 1 but the importance of speed in a game like this will always unfavourably impact it

@TaleSpun it's compounded by a cool but extremely poorly considered orders system which makes any single unit as strong as it needs to be to take objectives it shouldn't be able to. defense + demolition order is disgusting

@TaleSpun disappointing. vc1 is full of interesting strategy design but the ranking system and mission design warps a lot of interesting decision making around the scout's overwhelming capacity to move and take objectives
